page.title: 01Bewholme and District
page.content: This is an area of mainly mixed arable and stock farms, with the sea on the east side. The low lying cliffs are rapidly being eroded by the action of the sea. Caravan parks and camping sites are now encroaching on the farm land all down the coast. Bewholme once an arriculural village, although it has not increased in size, is now becoming a dormer village for workers in the towns. It still has a primary school, but older children go the comprehensive school in Hornsea. Atwick village is changing from agricultural to homes for the elderly and retired people mainly from the West Riding of Yorkshire. The only piece of industry is the caverns being gouged out of the rock salt underlying this area for the long term storage of vast quantities of natural gas.
